intro: Spartothamnus junceus, commonly known as the jointed sage, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Spartothamnus junceus typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
